column1: Rural Broadband is a necessity and the Coronavirus pandemic has put a spotlight on this issue. When Congress approves stimulus funds states should be able to use that money to expand their broadband infrastructure. https://t.co/YkAlqqfHvy
✅ Small and large businesses are reopening their doors ✅ Operation Warp Speed is working to get 300 million doses of a COVID-19 vaccine by January
Glad to be speaking today to the Guntersville Rotary club. One of the first in person meetings since the virus started.  (Proper Covid Precautions are being taken) https://t.co/eq2Ni4HCpu
So sorry to hear this news especially after it appeared his battle with Covid-19 had been won. My prayers go out to his family and his colleagues who I know are hurting.  https://t.co/wNFFxpEKqW

USDA has outlined initial findings from its ongoing investigation into cattle and beef price disruptions following COVID-19 and the Holcomb plant fire. In May I joined my colleagues in urging Sec. Perdue to conclude their investigation as quickly as possible.
CJS Subcommittee markup.  The people’s work on appropriations bills continues this week despite COVID-19. https://t.co/ADfm3qydbp

The fight against COVID-19 is not over help is still needed. Antibodies from people who have recovered from the virus can be used to save others. If you’re a survivor please consider donating plasma – you can learn more here: https://t.co/5W7maw8nAF

Leave it to Planned Parenthood to rob Americans of COVID-19 funding.   I guess taking life away from babies isn’t enough for them now it seems like they are also trying to take life away from small businesses. https://t.co/r2hYAnd5Op
When times called for cooperation Speaker Pelosi chose partisanship. When America needed to come together to address the remaining needs of COVID-19 Democratic leadership chose to go their own way.

In the last two months Congress has passed three economic relief packages with a great deal of bipartisan support. These bills weren’t perfect but they were necessary to combat COVID-19. We knew we needed to work together and we did.

China’s Communist regime will stop at nothing to cover up its role in the COVID-19 pandemic. They’re now hacking American research that’s trying to combat the virus. This is unacceptable. The CCP must be held accountable for blatant criminal acts like this https://t.co/iMc7RD8oZ6

Make sure to look up and catch the #HercsOverAlabama today! As a salute to the heroes on the frontlines of the COVID-19 pandemic the 908th Airlift Wing from @MaxwellAFB is conducting flyovers. Check out the times and locations below. https://t.co/exJFO2jNgP

The doctors nurses and emergency personnel on the front lines of the COVID-19 pandemic are heroes to us all. During Hospital Week let’s all make sure to thank our #HospitalHeroes for their service to our community! https://t.co/ObNTRciJAG

While the national media narrative seems to constantly highlight that the United States has the most COVID-19 cases it’s even more important to put things in perspective.  We have conducted the most testing and our per capita death rate is lower than many other countries. https://t.co/RvSErlimWY

Rural broadband has always been an essential need and the COVID-19 crisis has put a spotlight on that. We must address this issue in the Phase 4 stimulus and that’s why I sent a letter to House and Senate leadership today urging them to take action and fund rural broadband. https://t.co/PC2I03eYrw

Great news for Alabama! Funding from @HUDgov is headed our way. This allocation will make a positive and sizable impact for our communities that are struggling because of COVID-19. Thank you @SecretaryCarson https://t.co/uYvkIomKsn

Interesting numbers from Huntsville Hospital CEO David Spillers. Huntsville Hospital currently has one patient on a ventilator because of COVID-19.   They have 55 patients on ventilators for other conditions not related to COVID-19.

The Chinese Communist Party has been working for years to become a global pharmacy. And after blatantly lying and withholding information about COVID-19 I think it’s time we implement Buy America policies in the medical supply and pharmaceutical industry. https://t.co/aSCrA7SrZ7

This morning I went on with @TheDaleJackson to discuss the current COVID-19 situation.  One topic the Democrat proposal to Federalize elections and demand all voting by mail.  I think this would be a recipe for widespread fraud. https://t.co/d844k0PZz2

There is a clear link between unsanitary 'wet markets' and the creation of novel diseases like #COVID-19. The Chinese Communist Party must change course and implement safer food practices now. https://t.co/qMaQf79AAO
My website has a section dedicated to Coronavirus related Frequently Asked Questions.   There is a lot of useful information there.   https://t.co/YsFuSYFGzx

Red Land Cotton in Lawrence County known for their sheets made with Alabama grown cotton is now also making masks for healthcare professionals.  Thank you for stepping up to help during this current COVID-19 situation.  https://t.co/ZW1hQhX05b via @YouTube

Now that @realDonaldTrump has signed the 3rd Coronavirus stimulus bill into law help will start to flow to millions of Americans.  And @GOPLeader Kevin McCarthy was absolutely instrumental in guiding this bill through Congress.  Thank you!
I'm very sorry to hear of this first Coronavirus related death in Alabama.  I know this person's family must be going through a very difficult time.  https://t.co/0PDHOdr8DR

The COVID-19 epidemic requires fast action and relief to small businesses and families. This is not the time to write a partisan wish list in the Phase 3 stimulus. Here are some of the ridiculous proposals included:
Coronavirus outbreak shining an even brighter light on internet disparities in rural America https://t.co/Mj0Hqb3Xoh
Small businesses and non-profits can now apply for loans from the Small Business Administration if they have been impacted by the COVID-19 outbreak. https://t.co/UIp8E1haEy
The Alabama Cooperative Extension System has some great Coronavirus related tips on their website.  @ACESedu    https://t.co/yKbEH72e2b

I'm asking @realdonaldtrump to include more funding for rural broadband in the next Coronavirus relief package.  People in rural areas are struggling to work from home and do school work from home. #ruralbroadband #ReConnect @usda https://t.co/G9mhyWb6uI via @YouTube
Supporting Small Businesses Impacted by the Coronavirus https://t.co/QdLx1IoIY5 via @YouTube
Alabamians laid off or unpaid due to coronavirus are eligible for unemployment compensation https://t.co/tGQGRniHLF
Thank you to all of the healthcare professionals who are on the front lines of COVID-19 outbreak. Your dedication your concern and your compassion are greatly appreciated. https://t.co/b14RwFDoOe
We can do a lot during the next two weeks to dramatically bring down the number of cases of COVID-19 in our country. https://t.co/TfkvWIac3K

The @uscensusbureau announced some important guidelines today for college students.  Even if they have left campus because of the Coronavirus they are still to be counted as part of their college/university count.  More details are here: https://t.co/kO2uItLSK2 @AlabamaCounts
Some good news the JSU student who was tested for the coronavirus after having some symptoms has tested negative.

We know that people who are in nursing homes are probably the most vulnerable to COVID-19.  So I just want to say to all of the women and men who work at Alabama's nursing homes how much we appreciate everything you are doing to protect our elderly. Thank you! #nursinghomes

President Trump has declared Sunday a National Day of Prayer as one of the responses to the Coronavirus. Whether your church will be meeting Sunday or not I urge you to join in prayer for our nation during this time. https://t.co/Y09TgI0V9l

Thank you @realDonaldTrump & @VP for the update this afternoon on the Federal efforts to combat COVID-19. Declaring a national emergency will bring the full force of the federal government to bear to end this outbreak in our nation.
I've been on the phone this morning talking to hospitals across the 4th Congressional District to check on their preparedness for the Coronavirus. https://t.co/ad6cwzBEwR

The @CQ Photo of the Week:   FDA Commissioner Stephen Hahn and Rep. Robert B. Aderholt R-Ala. greet each other with an elbow bump one preventative measure against the spread of COVID-19 https://t.co/dYw3HLRFMp
It’s reassuring to see the actions @realDonaldTrump is taking to protect Americans from the Coronavirus. Steady leadership and not panic is what we need most at this time. #CoronaVirusUpdate
The @HHS announced today more state and local assistance is on its way –  $560m from the  @CDCgov to fight the coronavirus including more than $8 million for Alabama. https://t.co/2ylyLfIagC

While there has been some negative news in regard to the stock market and the coronavirus the reality is that the U.S. economy is not only sound it's continuing to grow.  273000 Americans were added to the payrolls last month. #Jobs https://t.co/7m7F7GmPOc

Alabama's State Health Officer Dr. Scott Harris gave me an update on the Coronavirus and it's possible impact on Alabama. He says the state is making preparations in case the virus starts to spread in the U.S. https://t.co/7jdVmCy8nU
